verses.verse: How <S%H3302>beautiful<s%> are thy <S%H6471>feet<s%> with <S%H5275>shoes<s%>, O <S%H5081>prince's<s%> <S%H1323>daughter<s%>! the <S%H2542>joints<s%> of thy <S%H3409>thighs<s%> are like <S%H2481>jewels<s%>, the <S%H4639>work<s%> of the <S%H3027>hands<s%> of a cunning <S%H542>workman<s%>.

Thy <S%H8326>navel<s%> is like a <S%H5469>round<s%> <S%H101>goblet<s%>, which <S%H2637>wanteth<s%> not <S%H4197>liquor<s%>: thy <S%H990>belly<s%> is like an <S%H6194>heap<s%> of <S%H2406>wheat<s%> set <S%H5473>about<s%> with <S%H7799>lilies<s%>.

Thy <S%H6677>neck<s%> is as a <S%H4026>tower<s%> of <S%H8127>ivory<s%>; thine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> like the <S%H1295>fishpools<s%> in <S%H2809>Heshbon<s%>, by the <S%H8179>gate<s%> of <S%H1337>Bath-rabbim<s%>: thy <S%H639>nose<s%> is as the <S%H4026>tower<s%> of <S%H3844>Lebanon<s%> which <S%H6822>looketh<s%> <S%H6440>toward<s%> <S%H1834>Damascus<s%>.

Thine <S%H7218>head<s%> upon thee is like <S%H3760>Carmel<s%>, and the <S%H1803>hair<s%> of thine <S%H7218>head<s%> like <S%H713>purple<s%>; the <S%H4428>king<s%> is <S%H631>held<s%> in the <S%H7298>galleries<s%>.
How <S%H3302>fair<s%> and how <S%H5276>pleasant<s%> art thou, O <S%H160>love<s%>, for <S%H8588>delights<s%>!
This thy <S%H6967>stature<s%> is <S%H1819>like<s%> to a palm <S%H8558>tree<s%>, and thy <S%H7699>breasts<s%> to <S%H811>clusters<s%> of grapes.

I <S%H559>said<s%>, I will go <S%H5927>up<s%> to the palm <S%H8558>tree<s%>, I will take <S%H270>hold<s%> of the <S%H5577>boughs<s%> thereof: now also thy <S%H7699>breasts<s%> shall be as <S%H811>clusters<s%> of the <S%H1612>vine<s%>, and the <S%H7381>smell<s%> of thy <S%H639>nose<s%> like <S%H8598>apples<s%>;

And the roof of thy <S%H2441>mouth<s%> like the <S%H2896>best<s%> <S%H3196>wine<s%> for my <S%H1730>beloved<s%>, that <S%H1980>goeth<s%> down <S%H4339>sweetly<s%>, causing the <S%H8193>lips<s%> of those that are <S%H3463>asleep<s%> to <S%H1680>speak<s%>.
Â¶ I am my <S%H1730>beloved's<s%>, and his <S%H8669>desire<s%> is toward me.
<S%H3212>Come<s%>, my <S%H1730>beloved<s%>, let us go <S%H3318>forth<s%> into the <S%H7704>field<s%>; let us <S%H3885>lodge<s%> in the <S%H3723>villages<s%>.

Let us get up <S%H7925>early<s%> to the <S%H3754>vineyards<s%>; let us <S%H7200>see<s%> if the <S%H1612>vine<s%> <S%H6524>flourish<s%>, whether the tender <S%H5563>grape<s%> <S%H6605>appear<s%>, and the <S%H7416>pomegranates<s%> bud <S%H5132>forth<s%>: there will I <S%H5414>give<s%> thee my <S%H1730>loves<s%>.

The <S%H1736>mandrakes<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> a <S%H7381>smell<s%>, and at our <S%H6607>gates<s%> are all manner of <S%H4022>pleasant<s%> fruits, <S%H2319>new<s%> and <S%H3465>old<s%>, which I have laid <S%H6845>up<s%> for thee, O my <S%H1730>beloved<s%>.
